p: A suggested concept of the baseline variability vs. trend originates from the studies Henson et al. ( 2010) and Beaulieu et al. ( 2013) of the satellite‐derived and modelled values of chl‐a. These studies suggested that the magnitude of natural variability in primary production and chlorophyll is larger than, or similar to, the climate change signal in contemporary, short (10 years) satellite record (Henson et al., 2010). Similarly, Boyd et al. ( 2008) suggested that change in the Southern Ocean primary production could not be separated from its high natural variability until approximately 2040.
